item.title: T1 Line Cost At A New Low
item.description:
For many companies, T1 lines have become a standard over time. Larger corporations adopted them early on for dedicated internet access, while smaller businesses often turned to T1 lines after encountering limitations with shared bandwidth services like DSL and Cable. The only drawback to T1 lines was their costâ€”or was it?
](http://www.t1t3today.com/)
If you associate T1 lines with exorbitant prices, your perception might be outdated. Less than ten years ago, a monthly fee of $1,000 for a standard T1 line wasn’t unusual...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/t1-line-cost-at-a-new-low/

item.title: PRI Phone Line Connections
item.description:
Analog business phone lines are suitable for small offices and retail spaces that don’t need many outside lines. If you require more than six lines, an option like ISDN PRI might be a better fit. ISDN PRI, which stands for Integrated Services Digital Network Primary Rate Interface, is a standard for transmitting calls digitally over regular phone lines. It’s the larger of two primary options, with the smaller being BRI (Basic Rate Interface)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/pri-phone-line-connections/
